page.title: 07Chilton Shop+++Orchid Centre
page.content: The only{village shop},which is also a sub-post office,has been owned for the past 12 years by Mr.and Mrs.Spiller.The building itself is over 200 years old and was originally used as a bakery.Mr. Spiller is confident that there will always be a need for the village shop despite competition from nearby superstores. +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ The Ratcliffe family{Orchid Centre}, built in 1936, registered in 1959, was opened to the public in 1979. Mr. Phillips,the present owner,has won over 200 awards,and"Miller's Daughter"-white and worth 2000 pounds,is his rarest orchid.2000 plants are raised weekly tended by 10 employees and sold to Garden Centres.Coach loads of orchid enthusiasts visit Mr.Phillips,who is th present chairman of the British Orchid Growers' Association.
